docs.snippet: Correction of discriminatory features of the exchange control systems of both Uruguay and Argentina should be primary considerations in any reciprocal trade agreements this country negotiates with those nations, according to foreign traders here last...
docs.lead_paragraph: Correction of discriminatory features of the exchange control systems of both Uruguay and Argentina should be primary considerations in any reciprocal trade agreements this country negotiates with those nations, according to foreign traders here last week.
docs.abstract: U S foreign traders want discriminatory Argentine and Uruguayan exch systems ended; new Argentine regulations expected to improve situation; pub hearings on pending trade treaties planned

headline.main: LATIN PACTS LINKED TO FREER EXCHANGE; Exporters Want Discrimination Ended in Argentine and Uruguayan Controls SOME RELIEF OBTAINED But Traders Hold Our Goods Get No Allotments or Face High Purchase Rates

headline.main: BAN ON CHAPLIN LIFTED; Buenos Aires Now Allowed to See 'The Great Dictator'

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 14 (UP) -- The first concrete military measure to aid the United States in South America in case it enters the war took form tonight with an announcement that the Uruguayan Government was preparing a formula under which "in...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 14 (UP) -- The first concrete military measure to aid the United States in South America in case it enters the war took form tonight with an announcement that the Uruguayan Government was preparing a formula under which "in defense of the interests of democracy" any Western Hemisphere nation warring with a country outside the hemisphere would not be considered a belligerent.

headline.main: URUGUAY WILL AID IF U.S. ENTERS WAR; Formula Being Drafted to Keep Her Ports and Bases Open to American Nations FOR HEMISPHERE DEFENSE Action to Modify Neutrality at Montevideo Follows Sink- ing of Robin Moor

docs.snippet: Twenty-six passengers and crew members of the British, liner Britannia, which was sunk March 27 by a German raider 600 miles off Dakar, French Equatorial Africa, with the loss of more than 100 lives, told yesterday morning of the twenty-three-day,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Twenty-six passengers and crew members of the British, liner Britannia, which was sunk March 27 by a German raider 600 miles off Dakar, French Equatorial Africa, with the loss of more than 100 lives, told yesterday morning of the twenty-three-day, 1,523-mile voyage in an open boat to the Brazilian coast by which they escaped death at sea.
docs.abstract: Brit SS Britannia survivors arrive, N Y C; describe 23-day life boat trip to Brazil

headline.main: SURVIVORS OF SHIP SUNK BY NAZIS HERE; 26 of 38 Who Made 1,523-Mile Trip From the Britannia to Brazil Arrive in Brooklyn SAILED LIFEBOAT 23 DAYS 44 Men Died During Voyage Held More Feasible Than 600-Mile Sail to Dakar

docs.snippet: WEEK ENDED JUNE 14, 1941 Not much happened in the foreign exchange market last week to distinguish it from preceding trading periods. Business was small and only unimportant price changes were recorded.
docs.lead_paragraph: WEEK ENDED JUNE 14, 1941 Not much happened in the foreign exchange market last week to distinguish it from preceding trading periods. Business was small and only unimportant price changes were recorded.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 15 -- The apparent intention of the Government of Uruguay to repeat its 1917 policy of granting full naval facilities to the United States in wartime is regarded as likely to bring a showdown throughout South America on the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 15 -- The apparent intention of the Government of Uruguay to repeat its 1917 policy of granting full naval facilities to the United States in wartime is regarded as likely to bring a showdown throughout South America on the question of continental defense.
docs.abstract: C R and Guatemala offer use of rys to U S for continental defense

docs.snippet: An invitation for a six-man United States track and field squad to compete in meets in Brazil, Uruguay and Argentina next September has been received and accepted by Daniel J. Ferris, the secretary-treasurer of the National A.A.U. announced...
docs.lead_paragraph: An invitation for a six-man United States track and field squad to compete in meets in Brazil, Uruguay and Argentina next September has been received and accepted by Daniel J. Ferris, the secretary-treasurer of the National A.A.U. announced yesterday.
docs.abstract: Inv to compete in Brazil, Uruguay and Argentina meets accepted

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICA SENDS BID TO U.S. TRACKMEN; Six Chosen at National Title Meet Will Make Trip

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 7 -- This capital is the headquarters of German, activities in South America. Here the Nazi High Command oversees and manipulates, with military precision and efficiency, a system of coordinated diplomacy, propaganda and...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 7 -- This capital is the headquarters of German, activities in South America. Here the Nazi High Command oversees and manipulates, with military precision and efficiency, a system of coordinated diplomacy, propaganda and trade that is amazing in its completeness and far excels in effectiveness the equivalent American and British activities.

headline.main: Argentina Center of Nazi Actions For Hitler's South American Plan; Italian Air Line Gives Link With Reich -- U. S. Newsprint Used to Spread Propaganda Against This Country

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 16 -- News that Brazil is negotiating with the United States concerning bases was not unexpected in Argentina, but it created a deep impression in all sectors of public opinion.
